page.title: 09AN APPROVED SCHOOL.
page.content: Donna Forster and Tracy Lally interviewed Mr Woodward head of education at Greystone Heath Approved School near Penketh. The school was built in for young offenders 1834 but now there is only the old gym left the rest is modern. The 24 boys mostly come from Liverpool. 10 years ago there were 104 boys, but now due to cuts there are only 24, the rest go to Foster homes. The boys are aged 14 to 16. It was set up here because there was a large number of Quakers living in Lancashire. The boys hate it here and occasionaly fights break out over small things like name calling. When improvement shows, the boys can go home if they've got one to go to. For the 24 boys, 36 staff are employed.In the past few years the number of petty crimes has risen.
